Improve this doc

Non-Assignable Expression
error in component ngModel 

Expression '{0}' is non-***REMOVED***ignable. Element: {1}

Description

This error occurs when expression the ngModel directive is bound to is a non-***REMOVED***ignable expression.

Examples using ***REMOVED***ignable expressions include:

<input ng-model="namedVariable">
<input ng-model="myObj.someProperty">
<input ng-model="indexedArray[0]">

Examples of non-***REMOVED***ignable expressions include:

<input ng-model="foo + bar">
<input ng-model="42">
<input ng-model="'oops'">
<input ng-model="myFunc()">

Always make sure that the expression bound via ngModel directive can be ***REMOVED***igned to.

For more information, see the ngModel API doc.
